an5.155:3.1: 155 The Decline of the True Teaching (2)
an5.155:4.1: “Mendicants, these five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.
an5.155:4.3: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t memorize the teaching—
an5.155:4.4: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired sayings, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and analyses.
an5.155:4.5: This is the first thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.
an5.155:5.1: Furthermore, a mendicant doesn’t explain the teaching in detail to others as they learned and memorized it.
an5.155:6.1: Furthermore, a mendicant doesn’t make others recite the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.
an5.155:7.1: Furthermore, a mendicant doesn’t recite the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.
an5.155:8.1: Furthermore, a mendicant doesn’t think about and consider the teaching in their heart, examining it with the mind as they learned and memorized it.
an5.155:8.2: This is the fifth thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.
an5.155:8.3: These five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.
an5.155:9.1: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.
an5.155:9.3: It’s when a mendicant memorizes the teaching—
an5.155:9.4: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired sayings, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and analyses.
an5.155:9.5: This is the first thing that leads to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.
an5.155:10.1: Furthermore, a mendicant explains the teaching in detail to others as they learned and memorized it.
an5.155:11.1: Furthermore, a mendicant makes others recite the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.
an5.155:12.1: Furthermore, a mendicant recites the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.
an5.155:13.1: Furthermore, a mendicant thinks about and considers the teaching in their heart, examining it with the mind as they learned and memorized it.
an5.155:13.2: This is the fifth thing that leads to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.
an5.155:13.3: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.”
